title: ComicPirates Weeklies (2012-04 - 2014-02).txt.rar
description:
Contains:   Plaintext contents listings covering all Weeklies (plus a few Monthlies
and one Annual) posted in the stated period by  <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipJ" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipJ</a>
and  <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipjolly" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/user/shipjolly</a>   , organized in three different ways.

Details:    First = 2012-04-11   |   Last = 2014-02-26   |   Count = 64,361

---

This is the first version directly compiled from the torrent metadata files (see <a href="
http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/9766179" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/9766179</a>   ), which while not entirely eliminating drastically cuts down on the manual portion of the work and thus on the potential for human error. So, not just new, but definitely improved! Furthermore, the entries are now richer in information, and of course standardized. Each line looks like this:

|t>13-11-13 0000|s>  706,556,689|n>The Art of Vampirella (2010) (digital-Empire).cbr

|t(imestamp)>   Two digits each for year, month, day, hour, minute of release. The time-of-day part is always 0000 and functions only as a placeholder in this listing.

|s(ize)>        Filesize in bytes, formatted for improved human readability. Fixed-width field with a 10-gig maximum; fingers crossed that'll suffice for a while yet!

|n(ame)>        This one, you'll just have to figure out on your own, I'm afraid! :P

---

The contained files are each sorted by two of those fields (none of them entirely unique by itself, due to chance, duplicate contents, identical naming, et cetera) - specifically, name then time ("by nt"), size then name ("sn"), time then name ("tn").
